オプション1: Star Man arrived near the area known as “Shii Poroporo.”
Unnamed: 5:
・オプション1は表示したいテキスト
・半角英数字は使用禁止
・３行まで
・オプション2は左に表示したい画像
・オプション3は右に表示したい画像

オプション1:
As he approached Shii Poroporo, a mist began to roll in.
While walking cautiously through it, he saw something glowing in the distance.
(Fireflies...? I think this might be my first time seeing one.)

Star Man walked toward the fireflies.
A clear river flowed with a gentle sound, and the entire area was blanketed in green moss.
(This place… it feels like somewhere humans aren’t meant to enter...)

Eventually, Star Man noticed someone following him from behind.
It was the same white figure he had seen before by the coconut trees.
Star Man turned to observe the figure.
The white figure stared at him expressionlessly.
The white figure gazed at Star Man with a look of curiosity.
"Did you give water to the children before?"

"Thank you. I’ll thank you on their behalf.
So, what are you doing here?"
"Nothing. I’m waste—there’s nothing for me to do."
"For now, I’ll believe what you’re saying."
(I wonder if he even understands what “beautiful” means...)
The experimental subject didn’t seem to understand.
"Those are fireflies. Did you know that?"

"Their glow, combined with the river, moss, and mist—
it all feels... magical to me."
The white figure looked like it was “processing” the idea.
"If I come back here, will I see you again?"

(Part of me wants the kids to meet him too...
but it’s also a little scary.)
Star Man headed back to the ruins.
The experimental subject stood on a hill. Another white figure was already there.
